block.p: Courtney Jane Gerber, the daughter of Penelope and A. Richard Gerber of Penllyn, Pa., was married yesterday to Christopher Ely Kunzelmann, the son of Joan A. and C. Dixon Kunzelmann of New York and Fisherton de la Mer, England. The Rev. Stanley E. Johnson, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church Whitemarsh in Fort Washington, Pa.

The bride, 30, is the senior vice president for corporate and foundation relations at the Welfare to Work Partnership in Washington. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford and received a master's degree with highest honors in elementary education from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father is the principal partner in Gerber & Gerber, a law firm in Blue Bell, Pa. Her mother is a member of the Pennsylvania Public Television Network Commission in Hershey, Pa.

Courtney Jane Gerber, the daughter of Penelope and A. Richard Gerber of Penllyn, Pa., was married yesterday to Christopher Ely Kunzelmann, the son of Joan A. and C. Dixon Kunzelmann of New York and Fisherton de la Mer, England. The Rev. Stanley E. Johnson, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Thomas' Episcopal Church Whitemarsh in Fort Washington, Pa.

The bride, 30, is the senior vice president for corporate and foundation relations at the Welfare to Work Partnership in Washington. She graduated from Trinity College in Hartford and received a master's degree with highest honors in elementary education from the University of Pennsylvania. Her father is the principal partner in Gerber & Gerber, a law firm in Blue Bell, Pa. Her mother is a member of the Pennsylvania Public Television Network Commission in Hershey, Pa.

The bridegroom, 29, a former stockbroker, is a pilot for Liberty Helicopters, a charter service in Linden, N.J. He graduated from Hobart College. His father, who worked in London, retired as the managing director for personnel at J. P. Morgan & Company..
